ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Through Mass NGO Society in Khamman District we have been involved in remotest villages, Lambada Thandas of ST villages, women development programs, abolition of child labor, fight against superstitious beliefs, untouchability, solving the problems of Daliths, fight against the harassment of women. We gave various awareness programmers to women like money saving, importance of literacy for their children, prayer and spiritual methods and to participate in government schemes and programs. We made these awareness programs through street plays and folk songs by being with them day and night and leading them from front. Even now they are able to gets government schemes, government loans, lands, houses, bore wells and so on. we used to accompany them in every situation and problems, hold students rallies, awarding the talented students, conduct awareness programs to different groups like women, youth etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ï‚— Established STI clinics in 7 Mandals to provide health services to 2600 HIV/AIDS prone key population, i.e. sex workers. ï‚— Initiation for the promotion of Natural regeneration of common lands in thousand acres of revenue hillocks ï‚— Implemented Water shed activites in 3500 acres ï‚— Padayatras with the objective of preventing the desertification process in Anantapuramu district ï‚— Leading Role in the creation of Ananta Paryavarana Parirakshana Samiti (APPS)- an environmental network ï‚— Demonstration of Domestic Defluoridation Filter Units (DDFUs) in Kadiri division Publication of Posters on excess fluoride content in the drinking water, 5 set of different posters on water, sanitation and Hygiene(WASH), Published WASH field manuals such as (1) Neeru, Paarishudhyamu, Parishubratha (a Book on Water Sanitation & Personal Hygiene), (2) Paarishudhyam Manchi Saamajika Pettubadi (Second Book on Water Sanitation & Personal Hygiene), (3) Cheruvlu Grameena Jeevana Rekhalu (a Book on Tanks Restoration), (4) A Book on Watershed Guidelines (5) A Book on the Rights of Un organized Rural labour ï‚— Assisted 7 GPs to achieve 7 Nirmal gram puraskar awards. ï‚— Assisted 1050 House Holds to avail sanitation facilities. ï‚— 49 drinking water sources were restored and 6623 HHs and 61 schools got safe drinking water. ï‚— 2220 Adolescent girls and 5630 women were motivated on MHM behaviors and they are practicing these behaviors. Social stigma on MHM was addressed. ï‚— A very good rapport developed with the district administration. ï‚— Identified and developed 159 core adolescent girls as trainers on MHM. ï‚— Translation of watershed guidelines into Telugu language ï‚— Every year number of Trainings are being conducted on various development programmes to the Farmers and Rural Youth. ï‚— Numbers of consultative meetings were held with the concerned government departments to promote WASH as one of the civil rights of the people. ï‚— Campaign against Violence on Women ï‚— Organized health awareness camps for the benefit of rural poor. ï‚— The Organization has motivated the community in 120 GPs of the district on WASH and in 21 GPs it has focused on school WASH. ï‚— We have constructed a Multi Purpose Resource Center to conduct training Programmes for Rural Masses
